reviews.review: Its a return to the great old days of a good bioshock game

Bioshock infinite: The game of my life.

I played it back in 2013, 8 years ago when I wasn't even 11. Since the first moment when we step into the Columbia, I fell in love with this game. 

The art-style is beyond any words, to combine the steampunk and early 20th century United States fashion might sound like a simple idea, yet the execution is beyond my words, the only correct one would be... perfect. All of this with amazing graphics that still look amazing to this day, except maybe for vegetation, fruits, human animations and eyes (some might say the latter two are too cartoony). 

And atmosphere, of course... It feels like bright cozy home when you are in bright locations, it makes you feel anxious in dark and sinister environment, it makes you sad when you see innocent people being a punchbag for the crowd's fun, and thats just the beginning.

Gameplay - Simple and yet detailed. As you progress through the story, you will find more guns (yet you can carry only 2) and vigors (two at the same time, BUT you can swap the one you don't want to use for another vigor), latter is a "magic spell", there is one for hypnosis, burning grenade, and more on as story progresses. There is also a sky-line, a railroad from which you can directly strike and insta-kill enemies (except for big guys), or just shoot them from above. Enemies differ in types, and further you go, more quantity and diversity: from a simple policeman, to a big ass handy guy (this one doesn't seem to be great for handshakes, I tried). Simple, easily learnt, and that's what so good about it. You understand the game and just get to perfecting your use of its mechanics, which always satisfy you.

Story - Gasp in surprise, laugh out of joy, and cry because of the end, then look for the truth and be happy because of the true end (after credits).

Story is everything in Bioshock Infinite, it is what drives those people, who don't like gameplay like me, to finish the game. It is what just tears apart 99% of modern video game stories. It is the... perfection of writing. Its complex, very difficult to understand, true. But when you collect all the voxaphones (audio files by different characters), when you complete game once more with more attention to every part, everything makes absolute sense. So much sense, that this story can't be called anything, but perfect. I won't spoil anything, you HAVE to experience it for yourself, it is an OBLIGATION for every person who knows what a video game is to experience the story of Bioshock Infinite. It is the pinnacle of the video game story, and no game has beaten it (I hope it will be beaten, but 8 goddamn years already passed, and so far - no change)

Bioshock Infinite redefined for me what a story driven video game SHOULD be. Yes I will love Last of us 1 and 2, yes uncharted series is a good plot driven series, yes Enderal: Forgotten Stories has amazing and shocking story, Yes Bioshock 1 has great, dark and twisted story, Yes, there are dragon age and mass effect series with very deep characters and lore, Yes there is famous Red Dead Redemption 1 and 2. AND YET NONE OF THEM CAN BEAT THE PERFECTION OF GODDAMN BIOSHOCK INFINITE (at the very damn least, for me).

It is saddening that the game ends, it is devastating that there is far too few games that can compete with it, it is sad that there is no game that would beat Bioshock Infinite for me. 

And yet I am happy that I love that game, I am happy I was able to witness it as a 10 year old Christian, and as a 18 year old atheist, I have seen it from both perspectives, and loved it from each one. This diamond of video games must be preserved at all costs and hailed forever.

Thank you Irrational Games for this Masterpiece, thank you for changing my mind, and life. Thank you for everything.

10/10. The True Definition of Art in Video Games.

Очень красивая игра. Это шутер от первого лица, который создала компания Irrational Games.
Здесь есть некая своя приятная атмосфера, благодаря которой ты погружаешься в игру полностью. Тебе предстоит путешествовать по летающей Колумбии в роли Букера Девитта, сражаясь со всеми, кто там только есть, в дополнениях мы будем путешествовать в городе, который находится под водой. Кстати, Я вам так же рекомендую купить все дополнения, они Вам пригодятся.
Сюжет закручен так, что ты вот-вот думаешь все будет отлично, но обязательно случится такое, что испортит все и добавит новых загадок в течении всей игры. В самой игре приятное музыкальное сопровождение, как и сам геймплей, довольно красивая и проработанная графика, нам легко стреляется из всего оружия.
Рекомендую эту игру пройти всем, Вам, как и мне - она очень понравится.

My short review to the game is: Don't buy it for the full price. I played roughly 8 hours to get it through, which is not a bad thing. The graphics are pretty, and there are some cool details. The gameplay is more or less the same all the time, from walking to places, following pathes, grinding on skylines and mashing down your enemies. The game deliveres a good difficulty, although some levels aren't that well made and you don't really get where you're getting shot at.
Now the biggest thing that bugged me is that there were dialogs which didnt support surround sound. So for example you here the person in front of you only on your right ear. And even when you turn around and she's on your left side, the sound stays on the right side. I had that with no other game than here.

So in short, buy it if you're interested and you could get it for less money, then it's worth it.

Pros
+ This storyline will blow your mind (in a good way). Riveting and addictive and the kind of story where to truely appreciate it you need to playthrough again after knowing how it ends.
+ The atmosphere is fantastic... everything from sound to skins transport you to Columbia
+ Voice acting is superb
+ Graphics are really quite impressive
+ Combat is fast-paced and frantic but balanced in a way that makes it very enjoyable
+ Enemies are challenging and varied
+ Zipline-like rail feature is like riding a rollercoaster and so much fun
+ An admirable mix of RPG elements for upgrading guns and vigours and having special clothing
+ Levels are challening and continuously unique
+ Vigours are unique and have very little crossover with Bioshock 1 & 2

Cons
- Save System is one of the worst I have ever seen from a large studio. I liked the idea of trying to eliminate the user from quicksaving everytime they turn a corner but this autosave feature was really poorly implemented.
- Can only run a single game at a time
- Ran into one pathing bug where I got stuck in a wall. Wouldn't have been a big deal except for the awful save functionality. As it was I had to replay a not insignificant part of the game.
- Level design is linear for the most part and choices don't have any true significance (but honestly this didn't bother me considering the storyline - it's clear the devs sacrificed openess for storytelling)
- Rail traveling might not be ideal for players prone to motion sickness
It's a must have.

This game is, in my opinion, a future classic. Not that there aren't any nitpicks, but overall, this game is pretty solid. I have played through this game twice, once on Medium, once on Hard. In the future, I might try 1999 mode, which is the hardest mode after Hard, and is only unlocked after beating Medium mode. Overall, I'd say there is a definite challenge, but I'd recommend heading straight to Medium mode.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Elizabeth. What can be said that hasn't already been said? Usually, a video game ally requires that you keep them alive, and are usually very stupid and bumbling. But Liz is fantastic. Not only is she always safe, but she's also crucial to the plot, and, most importantly, she throws you ammo, salts, and health during fights. This is important in two ways: 1) it keeps you fighting longer, without dying (because dying, in this game, is worth money), and 2) makes her important. When she's no around, you actually miss her, wish that she were there, because she's absent from the field, and therefore not there adding to the plot and giving you supplies. This is very smart. By making her useful, you become attracted to her. By making you invested in the character, you actually feel a sense of urgency and necessity to getting her back (as she does disappear from time to time). This makes finding her an actual desire, rather than a chore, and therefore investing your attention. Also, I thank 4K for not making Liz a love interest. Even though she is attractive (and wears some low-cut shirts later in the game), she and Booker never have any attraction between them; it's just a matter of business, and, later, friendship. This is a fantastic move, away from other triple-A titles of recent years, whose crutch is a busty, attractive female character whose sole purpose is to simply exist as an attractive woman, rather than a useful, interesting, friendly person like Liz.
+Even on low graphic settings, the vistas and views from the flying barges and skylines are spectacular. Seeing the misty clouds, floating buildings, and the sun filtering through the trees is pretty darn cool. I'm not sure how great the improvement is to max graphics settings, but that's for others to decide.
+Sounds, guns are punchy and entertaining. Everything feels explosive and action-packed. There's nothing more invigorating than flying around, shooting your foes with a carbine, or taking down a heavy with your RPG. It's unbelievably fun.
+Gear system is a new addition to the "Bioshock" series; you can equip clothes, or "gear", that you can find in locked rooms and hidden places. A hat, for example, may give you the ability to light enemies on fire when you Skyline-Strike them. Or a pair of lovely pants that refill your health when you respawn. The cosmetics don't alter your appearence, however, and are simply stats. Also, I swear that in my two play-throughs, I found different cosmetics, and missed some I'd already found, giving greater variety to the system. [Notice: I've encountered a strange glitch involving a certain hat, which, upon equipping, crashes my game. It's very strange, not sure if anyone else has this issue, but not an error that ruins the game]
+The story is fantastic. It is able to talk about contemporary topics of the 1910's in a non-subjective way that allows the player to think for themselves, and make their own moral decisions. The story is well played out, paced well, and fairly interesting. Definitely one of my favorite plots of all time. 

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Vigors are useless. They're useful in a few places, and they're an absolute riot to use, even more so than the older games. But unlike the original games, wherein the plasmids were useful not only for taking down or stunning enemies but to also open areas and clear atmospheric obstacles, the vigors serve no purpose other than killing foes and opening something specific to the game's storytelling. I found that, in my initial play-through, every firefight could be just as easily won through bullets as with combined arms. Unlike in the original games, where bullets are expensive and hard to come by, ammo and money are literally [u]everywhere[/u], so you're almost never out of cash to spend on ammunition for your shotgun.
-The boss fights are really annoying. Have you ever hated game bosses where they simply lock you in a condfined space and tell you to just kill a ton of dudes? That's every boss in this game.
-Enemies are pretty boring. 90% of the time, you'll spend your time fighting plain humans, although with assorted weapons. The special enemies, such as the "Firemen", "Motorized Patriots", "Boys of Silence", "Crow" and "Handyman", are rather interesting, and each require a different strategy to beat. For example, you can take the vigor you receive later in the game, the "Return to Sender", to catch the Fireman's bombs and whip them back at him. However, but there aren't enough of them for it to feel fun. 
-The game lacks a lot of the scary elements of the original games, trading in terror at sea for high-flying shooting in the sky.
-There are many more guns than in the previous games, but half of the guns are simply the same thing as the other half (one half are the regular weapons, the other half are "Vox Populi" remakes, with slightly different stats).
-Unlike in the previous games, you can only carry two weapons at a time, and all of your vigors, as compared to the first game (which allowed you to carry all of your weapons at once). This makes some firefights hard, and you have to plan to carry one short-range, one long-range gun (i.e. a shotgun and a carbine). 
-One aspect of the original games that made combat interesting that was left out of this game was the different ammo types, which allowed you to have certain bullets that deal with heavy armor rather than flesh. I missed this in "Bioshock: Infinite".
-The game offers, in a few places, decisions over whether to choose a specific action or not. However, after playing the game again, I came to the conclusion that the decisions did not actually matter (as in, they didn’t hold any bearing on the ending, such as the first two "Bioshock" games did with the collection of "Little Sisters" on the good/neutral/bad ending).

[b]Final Verdict:[/b]
I enjoyed this game, as evident in my 25+ hours playing the game twice. There are definitely some things I didn’t approve of, such as the low weapon inventory, expensive revivals, too few good enemies, and uninspired vigors. But overall, the thrill of flying along the skyline, firing my pistol on the guards below, jumping down on the enemies with a skyline strike, makes it a pretty fun game. It may be one of my favorite games, but it's not my absolute favorite. 
My biggest note about this game was the feeling I encountered after I finished it; it didn't feel like a "Bioshock" game. I have not played the second game in the series, but I felt fairly familiar with the plot and atmosphere of the first. Whereas the first game was about searching for every scrap of ammo and health, trying to save yourself from the splicers and other insane inmates of Rapture's sunken Hell, "Bioshock: Infinite" is about high-flying action. There's no premise of survival, simply enjoying the ride and unlocking the secrets of Columbia. They're different game types, they emphasize different strategies, and they vary in styles. They're so different, except for their references, that I couldn't tell they were related. This doesn't mean they're bad. They're both [u]fantastic[/u]. Point made.

[b]Verdict: 9/10[/b]

I wanted this game so bad after all of the great reviews I've read all over the internet. The best bioshock ever !! 10/10

Nachdem ich "BioShock Infinite" durchgespielt und von "BioShock 1" die ersten paar Stunden angespielt habe, lässt sich für mich ein großer Unterschied klarstellen: "BioShock Infinite" besitzt eine deutlich hellere Atmosphäre. Und mit deutlich, meine ich auch deutlich.
Ich erinnere mich immer an die wundervolle Aussicht, die man nun nicht mehr auf die düstere Unterwasserwelt Rapture sondern von der Wolkenstadt Columbia aus hat. Schon allein das, hat für mich das Spielgefühl angenehm gemacht. Dazu kam die Story, die ich gerne verfolgt habe und den ein oder anderen 'wtf?'-Moment parat hatte. Die große Auswahl an Waffen und Kräften hat auch die Kämpfe abwechslungsreich gestaltet.
Was mir persönlich besonders gut gefallen hat ist die Zeit, nämlich 1912, in der sich das Szenario abspielt und wie sie umgesetzt wurde - die Musik, die Charaktere, ...
Im Großen und Ganzen kann ich sagen, ich habe "BioShock Infinite" sehr gerne gespielt, noch lieber als die Vorgänger und kann es sehr empfehlen für Leute, die eine angenehme Atmosphäre, etwas Geballer und eine gute Story in einem Spiel suchen.

BioShock Infinite, que decírte?

La relación que tengo con este juego es algo que va mas allá de lo natural, mas allá de las constantes, las variables y los infinitos universos plagados de posibilidades. La gran realidad es que lo jugué antes de mi llegada a Steam, muchas veces, pero aún así decidí comprarlo pero no como un apoyo hacia los desarrolladores sino como un completo, sincero y gigante agradecimiento. 

GRACIAS 2K, GRACIAS IRRATIONAL GAMES. 

Crearon una obra de arte digna de ser exhibida en un museo dentro de unos cuantos años, digno de ser considerado uno de los mejores videojuegos de la historia... Qué digo videojuegos? Una de las mas maestras obras de arte audiovisual. 

No soy un gran fanático de hacer listas exponiendo los pro/con de los juegos, quizá soy mas sentimental y hablo de lo que sentí. Habrá gente a la que no le guste y como dice el dicho "para gustos, colores". Es completamente aceptable que el juego termine no gustándoles, pero es inaceptable el hecho de no darle una oportunidad.

La realidad puede ser negada, pero nunca puede ser evadida. Y la realidad sobre BioShock Infinite es simple: OBRA MAESTRA. Créanme, no se van a arrepentir de comprarlo.

Yo lo compré en oferta y me arrepentí de no haber pagado el precio completo.

Сомнительный сюжет?
Скучный и однообразный геймплей?
Непродуманный и нелогичный мир?
Разошедшийся по интернетам маскот, представляющий из себя по сути пустой манекен без характера и внятной мотивации, с внешностью и поведением диснеевской принцессы?
Отсутсвие философского посыла, характерного для первых частей?
Урезанная боевая система?
Скучная кастомизация оружия сводящаяся к "заплати - получи +1 к урону"?
Псевдонелинейность, никак не влияющая на сюжет?
Переоцененный коридорный шутер, не заслуживающий слова "Bioshock" в названии?

Увы, ответ на все эти вопросы - да. Если вы неприхотливы и ищете шутер на вечерок, чтобы после тяжелого трудового дня пробежаться по красивым локация, посасывая пивко и радуясь фансервису в лице Элизабет, то эта игра для вас. Остальным (читай, нормальным людям) следует обойти этот "шедевр" десятой дорогой. Купите второго ведьмака, Deus Ex: Human Revolution, или на худой конец, вернитесь в первую часть, почуствуйте величие и упадок Восторга, задумайтесь о судьбе неоднозначных персонажей, удивитесь необычной кастомизации оружия. И осознайте, что такое настоящий Bioshock.

Un des jeux à faire une fois dans sa vie.

I was looking forward to playing this game, sadly it triggers motion sickness in me,  I've not experienced that in any other game.
It's a beautiful looking game, but so disappointing that as yet I can't really play it.

I really find it hard to believe this is the same guy who made System Shock 2, that was a great game.

Bioshock Infinite's combat is childishly easy and bland, and the magic system is completely ignorable. The story ends a little badly, but it's entertaining enough on the first playthrough to warrant finishing. The environments and ambiance of the world is really great, if you can believe people move from floating island to floating island via spinny hook-guns. The voice-acting and NPCs chattering is pretty nice too.

I wish this game had the depth of System Shock 2, and all the great visuals were carried over there. It's not the worst game in the world but I can't recommend it unless on sale, SS2 was insanely better.
Complex, riviting plot combined with solid gameplay make this a must have.

Eu realmente não sei como eu não poderia ter comprado e/ou jogado este jogo antes! É sensacional, do início ao fim! É desafiante, empolgante e chega a ser cativante.
 Incrível mesmo é não se impressionar com Elizabeth e com todas as suas expressões faciais tão reais, às vezes brava, ora doce, ora pasma e vice-versa... Tem uma caracteristica única para uma protagonista, e não há como não se apaixonar por ela e pelo jogo em si... Sem falar que nos momentos mais apurados ela sempre lhe joga itens ou te ajuda de alguma forma.

 O enredo é sensacional, não vá querendo descobrir ou destramar tudo de uma vez - espere até o final, vale à pena -, deixe o enredo fluir e fazer parte de você também, pois aposto que você vai ficar boquiaberto, assim como eu, no final! De todos os jogos, esse é o que mais me cativou. Comprei ele por um pacote de trinta e quatro reais e noventa centavos, 34,90$, senão me falha a memória, a trilogia! Fascinante e épico, e recomendo: compraria pelo preço que está agora, pois vale a pena!

 Zerei uma única vez e assim que sobrar tempo irei zerá-lo novamente, inclusive tentar pegar todas conquistas e também no modo "1999", e espero ter dinheiro pra comprar todas DLC'S, pois acho que vale super à pena também!

 Bem, eu curti muito esse jogo e o recomendo a qualquer hora, senão está convencido, se convença e o compre já! Um abraço à todos e bom divertimento!
Zarabista gra

Эта игра вызывает восхищение с первых секунд, как только мы ее запускаем.Приятная графика, великолепные диалоги,интересный сюжет.А впрочем большего и не надо.Если прощёл игру,то есть ещё 2 сюжетных длс что может увеличить кол-во часов в этой игре.
Awesome game and story line :D
One of my favorite games of all time.
Weakest game in the series in my opinion, it just doesn't have the atmosphere the other 2 had however still it's a great game with a epic story and a mind-blowing ending, well worth playing..

This game and its Burial at Sea expansions are the BEST games I have ever played or seen. The story is so compelling and immersive that I find it hard not to go back for more. The game is very confusing but after watching some theory videos on Youtube, the game gets even better. For any that are thinking about buying this game, I highly suggest getting it ASAP! This game and its expansions will make you love and hate each character and ultimately want more of them after playing through.


Also as a warning, the end of Episode 2 will make you cry your heart out.

Un buen juego que nada tiene que envidiar al primer Bioshock. El labado de cara de ciberpunk a steampunk le ha sentado a la serie de maravilla. Esta vez, meha parecido mas dificil que el primero ya que solo puedes llevar 2 armas a la vez. Su final es simplemente magnífico y confuso.
Beautiful game, not set in the world of the original Bioshock games (except Burial at Sea DLCs) but still a masterpiece worthy of the name Bioshock.

Mi è piaciuto tantissimo l'ultimo titolo della saga Bioshock, e credo sia uno dei migliori giochi degli ultimi anni, l'unica cosa è che forse l'andamento verso il finale è troppo veloce e avventato.. Insomma credo che aver approfondito un po' di più la trama, aggiungendo anche solo 2 ore non sarebbe stata una brutta idea.
Un jeu fait pour les adepte du Steampunk !

No es la segunda llegada de dios a la tierra, pero de lejos uno de los mejores Triple A de los últimos años, te entretenida, pero no es nada innovador en jugabilidad, si esperais otro Bioshock 1 este no lo alcanza en calidad general, pero tiene una buena historia, buena ambientación, grandes personajes, gran diseño artístico, lo que le falta a mi juicio es esa variedad que tenía el Bioshock original a nivel de jugabilidad, pero en líneas generales este es un buen juego que te entretendrá y te gustara.

What I love the most about BioShock Infinite:
~Beautiful scenery
~Awesome story
~Amazing plot twist
~Elizabeth
เป็นหนึ่งในเกมแห่ง 2013 ที่คุณต้องเล่น มันความดิบโหดในตัวและให้บรรยากาศยุคโบราณที่ดี เพลงเพราะ สนุก แต่ใช้เวลาไม่นานในการเล่นจบ
Schöne Grafik, spielt sich super und die Story ist stimmig! - Kaufempfehlung!
Excellent story and gameplay - ending blew my mind

One of the most twisted yet satisfying storylines in a video game. It made my brain hurt..

Would open a tear again 10/10

BioShock Infinite , sem dúvidas um grande jogo , a história é muito complexa , muito boa . Os personagens tem uma caracteristica pessoal muito foda , o cenário apesar de ser em cidades flutuantes , varia muito , não te deixa entediado em momento algum .
De fato é necessário explorar bem o jogo para poder ter uma boa experiência , caso contrário não será tão proveitosa a diversão no game ...
Os próximos BioShock deveriam seguir este contexto .


10/10

Avevo questo gioco in libreria già da un po' ma a causa del poco tempo me lo ero quasi dimenticato... CHE ERRORE!!!
La mia cultura videoludica inizia con duke nukem 3d nel lontano 1996 e bioshock infinite entra di prepotenza nella mia top3 dei miei sparatutto più belli di sempre!

Eguagliare il primo Bioshock era difficile, ma superarlo lo era ancora di più!

Le dinamiche di gioco sono divertenti e ben sviluppate, si riprende il vecchio concetto di plasmide migliorandolo con un interfaccia d'uso più semplice ed intuitiva, l'arsenale a dispozione è molto vasto, i nemici ben disegnati e l'ambientanzione di Columbia eguglia Rapture!

Il pezzo forte è la trama, sempre più bella e coinvolgente mano a mano che la storia prosegue, grandioso il personaggio di Booker, ma Elizabeth l'ho letteralmente adorata!!!

Se non avete questo gioco nella vostra libreria è il momento di rimediare!! ORA!!!!
Voto 10/10
It's good, then crazy, and crazy good.

Первое прохождение заняло 11 непрерывных часов, в конце пошла дикая психоделика (аля старый макс пейн) с путешествием сквозь простартсво и время. Сюжет неплох, геймплей тоже. Все умения или оружие на максимум не качнуть в 1 прохождение.
Из - отмечу, что можно использовать не более 2 видов оружия за раз, из-за чего приходится делать акцент только на том, на чем будете тащить большую часть времени.
Short, quaint, tries to be deep with a plot that Philip K. Dick might have looked at 40 years ago.
Beautiful game in every way a true classic and must be played by anyone who considers themselves a gamer 10 out of 10.

the best story i have ever seen. The gameplay is good and the voices are the best part.
You dont need to play Bioshock 1 or 2 to play this one (unless you wanna play the Burial at sea DLC, then you have to play the first game)
The story is amazing and it will take some time to you to understand after you finish it, but when you get it, you will start telling everyone you know about this game.
Gameplaytechnisch sehr durchschnittlich und nicht besonders überzeugend. Dafür punktet es bei der Story so richtig! Hat eines der besten Enden in der Videospielgeschichte.

Отличный сюжет и обстановка игры. Элизабет лучший помощник, которого можно дать. Не то, что боты из cs:go. Всем помогает, радует, и такая красивая. Советую всем игру, жаль, что сразу не взял. Не понял, что происходит в игре. Так как видео обзор в стиме странный. Надеюсь когда человек в cs:go ливнет, ко мне зайдёт не бот, а Элизабет. :)
Кстати не был готов к концу игры, было так обидно, когда у водопада был. А дальше не скажу.

Amazing story, great gameplay. Even good replay value to pick up on all the Easter Eggs you don't realize are there during the first playthrough. Great game.
By far one of my favourite series's I can tell that the people who made this are the same genius's behind system shock and thief.

This is a game I had to force myself to stop playing.  From start to finish the graphics were awesome.  Apart from some AI glitches which most games have, I would say this game was a fantastic addition to the BioShock franchise.

I would rate this game 4/5.

It took a very long time to beat and some of the achievements were absolutely rediculous.  RNG must be on your side.  Overall a great game that I would recommend to any of my friends the next time it comes on sale for $10-15 with all the expansions and the first two games BioShock 1 & BioShock 2.
